attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content:
Amboy, California. Once a popular destination along Route 66 until Interstate 40 passed nearby in 1972. 

Today the population is 4.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: In 1907, the boomtown of Rhyolite, Nevada, had electric lights, water mains, telephone lines, two newspapers, a hospital and an opera house.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: Shorty's Penguin
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: Shorty Harris lay on his belly in the Black Rock desert, booze sick and clawing at the sand.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: text
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: text
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: He ripped his shirt from his back and bunched it over his face to block out the burning light.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: He peeked to see if the bird was still there. A hulking pink penguin with dead black eyes flapped its wings and grinned.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: Gold was here. The bird told him so.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: The thing scared the hell out of Shorty but it also got him rich, although that was decades ago and the money was long gone.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: The penguin spun in circles, telling him things, flashing coordinates and jibberish.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: text
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: The penguin spun in circles, telling him things, flashing coordinates and jibberish.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: How many men had died under this sun? Plenty, but not Shorty.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: He was pushing seventy and he needed redemption. That’s what the desert was for.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: He began making snow angels in the sand, thinking about the old days when everything was tinged with gold.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: The gold is right here. Get back to town and tell them.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: “I’m an old fool,” he croaked. “I’ve been busting out for years.”
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: He hit it good back in 1904 when he and old Ed Cross trekked into a bleached canyon east of Death Valley. At first it looked like a bust.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: At first it looked like a bust.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: Then Shorty saw the bird for the first time. He swung his pick at it and the ground split apart, giving up turquoise chunked with gold.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: “It was all green and yellow like the back of a bullfrog,” he told the newspapers.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: More than two hundred mining camps sprung up in the brand new town of Rhyolite, all of them called Bullfrog something or other.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: Shorty named his goldmine 'Bullfrog'.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: text
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: Everybody had Bullfrog fever, and Rhyolite boomed with camps, saloons, dance halls, and Okies staking claims every which way.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: They used to love Shorty. Now they mocked him. They played pranks on him when he passed out at the tavern.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: one time in a coffin
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: "Not like I got anything to show for it," Shorty murmured, spitting bile in the sand. "Gave it away. Kept the whole town drunk for months."
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: Quit your chattering. The gold is right here, right under you. Go get a crew.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: Today it is a ghost town.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: "What if I’m wrong? I can’t be wrong again."
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: The bird vanished. Shorty creaked to his feet and planted a juniper stick in the sand. He walked back to town, praying the bird was right.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: A family from Wisconsin was snapping photos of Rhyolite’s ruins. Their kid pointed at a sculpture of a miner and a penguin in the distance.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: A sunburnt old man kneeled next to the kid. "You bet that’s a penguin out here in the desert. That’s a tribute to our friend Shorty."
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: "He’d be out in the desert drinking from his bottle of O’ Joyful and after a time he’d see a pink penguin following him around.”
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: The father flashed a nervous grin and pulled his boy away.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: He woke up in cupboards and coffins.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: "How the hell else you think Tom Kelly built that house outta fifty thousand beer bottles so fast?"
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: Bullfrog companies popped up overnight. Giant Bullfrog. Bullfrog Merger. Bullfrog Apex. Bullfrog Annex. Bullfrog Gold Dollar. Bullfrog Bar.
attr.title: Text Layer

attr.content: A story by James A. Reeves
attr.title: Text Layer
